landing.subtitle: Built for junior developers. Take a quick quiz, discover your profile, and receive tailored guidance every day.

step1.title: When something breaks, how do you usually debug?
step1.debug_console: I add console.log and try to narrow it down
step1.debug_debugger: I use the debugger (breakpoints) when I can
step1.debug_stack_trace: I read the stack trace and follow the code path
step1.debug_rubber_duck: I explain the problem to someone or a rubber duck first
step1.debug_search_error: I search the error message and try fixes from the web

step2.title: When you're stuck on a task, what do you do first?
step2.stuck_google_first: Google or search for a solution right away
step2.stuck_try_then_ask: Try for 30+ minutes on my own, then ask for help
step2.stuck_docs_first: Read the official docs or source code first
step2.stuck_ask_teammate: Ask a teammate or mentor for direction
step2.stuck_take_break: Take a break and come back later

step3.title: How do you approach learning a new codebase?
step3.codebase_dive_in: I dive in and make small changes to see what happens
step3.codebase_readme_first: I read the README and main entry points first
step3.codebase_trace_flow: I trace one user flow or feature end-to-end
step3.codebase_ask_walkthrough: I ask the team for a walkthrough or pairing session
step3.codebase_own_only: I rarely do; I'm usually maintaining my own code

step4.title: Which of these do you do regularly? (select all that apply)
step4.habit_refactor: Refactor or improve existing code without being asked
step4.habit_read_watch: Read technical blogs or watch talks

step5.title: When you get critical code review feedback, you usually:
step5.feedback_fix_move_on: Fix the comments and move on quickly
step5.feedback_note_pattern: Note the pattern so I don't repeat it
step5.feedback_ask_why: Ask why and discuss tradeoffs with the reviewer
step5.feedback_discouraged: Feel discouraged and put the PR off

step6.title: In one sentence, what's your main career or skill goal right now?
step6.placeholder: e.g. Land a backend role in 6 months, or get better at debugging
